segment.source: How to Add a Server
segment.target: How to Add a Server

segment.source: How to Add a Server
segment.target: How to Add a Server

segment.source: How to Add a Server
segment.target: How to Add a Server

segment.source: To help you manage your Application Virtualization Management Servers more efficiently, organize them into server groups.
segment.target: To help you manage your Application Virtualization Management Servers more efficiently, organize them into server groups.

segment.source: After you create a server group in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, you can use the following procedure to add a server to the group.
segment.target: After you create a server group in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, you can use the following procedure to add a server to the group.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: All servers in a server group must be connected to the same data store.
segment.target: All servers in a server group must be connected to the same data store.

segment.source: To add a server to a group
segment.target: To add a server to a group

segment.source: Click the Server Groups node in the left pane to expand the list of server groups.
segment.target: Click the Server Groups node in the left pane to expand the list of server groups.

segment.source: Right-click the desired server group, and select New Application Virtualization Management Server.
segment.target: Right-click the desired server group, and select New Application Virtualization Management Server.

segment.source: In the New Server Group Wizard, enter the Display Name and the DNS Host Name.
segment.target: In the New Server Group Wizard, enter the Display Name and the DNS Host Name.

segment.source: Leave the default values in the Maximum Memory Allocation field for the server cache and the Warn Memory Allocation field to specify the threshold warning level.
segment.target: Leave the default values in the Maximum Memory Allocation field for the server cache and the Warn Memory Allocation field to specify the threshold warning level.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: In the Connection Security Mode dialog, check the Use enhanced security box to select enhanced security mode, if desired.
segment.target: In the Connection Security Mode dialog, check the Use enhanced security box to select enhanced security mode, if desired.

segment.source: If necessary, complete the Certificate Wizard or view existing certificates.
segment.target: If necessary, complete the Certificate Wizard or view existing certificates.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: In the App Virt Port Setting dialog, select the Use Default Port or the User Custom Port radio button and enter the custom port number.
segment.target: In the App Virt Port Setting dialog, select the Use Default Port or the User Custom Port radio button and enter the custom port number.

segment.source: Click Finish.
segment.target: Click Finish.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Create a Server Group
